cohort.reelThemIn: Marketing Analytics professional with 8 years of startup + enterprise experience
cohort.bio: I'm currently the Manager of Ecommerce Analytics at Smile Direct Club, an orthodontic technology startup in downtown Nashville. After six years of managing multi-million dollar Google Ad campaigns for companies like Marriott Hotels and Dun & Bradstreet, I transitioned to the data analytics side of the room. I use SQL & R in my daily work to clean, analyze, and deliver insights to my teammates in the marketing and digital departments.
Passionate about empowering districts, schools and community members to use data to better understand student needs.

Have background in Mathematics, Economics and Finance. Worked in different business industries and research institutions. Practically learned skills in different business contexts. Enthusiastic in Data Science and solving business problems using data and statistical models. I am interested in Health, Finance and Development Policies. Enjoy helping people.

I am a chemist/structural biologist-turned-Data-Scientist, with extensive experience in scientific research, project management, and computer administration. Skilled in SQL/Python/R  and hands-on experience in data mining and analysis to translate real world complex data into insights by using state-of-the art techniques such as machine learning and deep learning.

cohort.reelThemIn: Engineer turned Data Scientist eager to make an impact
cohort.bio: I have a Master's in Mechanical Engineering and spent some time doing machine design as a mechanical engineer. But the part I enjoyed most about my schooling and jobs was any time I could do some programming. I found I have a passion for data science. I believe the use of data can transform just out about every company or organization by providing a basis for decision making. I'm alway looking for ways to learn and improve my skills in ever changing world of data science.

As a Biomedical Scientist turned Data Scientist, I am excited to be able to elevate my years in academia to a new level where I am able to not only visualize complex problems with visualization tools, but also discover insights that enable me to make predictions from real-world data. I am eager to continue to learn, apply my knowledge, my creativity, my years of approaching solving scientific problems, and my data science skills to solve issues in an industry I am passionate about, healthcare.
Preceded by roles in Logistics and with a degree in Economics, I am excited to begin the next step in my career as an aspiring Data Scientist.

cohort.reelThemIn: Novice data scientist looking to use analytical skills to debunk common cliches and platitudes.
cohort.bio: Graduated from the University of Virginia in 2015 with a degree in policy and minor in economics. I have worked in low-income education the last four years as a middle school math teacher, instructional coach, and curriculum writer. I became interested in data science when I implemented a data driven instructional model in my classroom and witnessed a noticeable increase in student growth. I will continue my data science education this fall by pursuing a MS in business analytics at the Raymond A Mason School of Business at William and Mary. Upon graduation, I hope to use data science to improve student achievement in k-12 education or counter market distortions in the U.S. healthcare market.

I've been working in the healthcare space in a variety of 'data-adjacent' roles for a number of years and came to NSS to dig deep into code, predictive analytics and machine learning.  I'm interested in things I haven't tried before.  I think there's interesting work to be done in the marketing and media spaces but I think any industry can benefit from advanced analytics and data science.  I love working with curious people who get excited by solving problems. and have fun overcoming challenges.

I am a healthcare information technology professional who is passionate about leveraging data science and analytics to improve operational processes and health outcomes. I am a strong believer that the answers to healthcare's most compelling issues lie at the intersection between clinical knowledge, innovation, and data science, and my desire is to contribute my analytical thinking and technical skills at an organization dedicated to improving healthcare.

For nearly five years, I have worked as a PhD student at Vanderbilt University studying how black holes formed in the first billion years of the Universe. During my time as a PhD student, I have developed a passion for extracting meaning from data.  My enthusiasm for data has led me to study data science at Nashville Software School, where I have begun to learn how to translate my skills into the data science domain. During my time at NSS, I have gained exposure to machine learning techniques and developed a strong interest in text analysis and natural language processing.

I have a Scientific Background in Health care and Hospital Industry. I am always curious about the inter-relationship between science and technology and I seek to solve challenging business problems using Data Analytical Skills.

My interest in data science stems from my intrigue of models in topics I enjoy such as sports, health care, and environmentalism. I appreciate what can be read from complex systems; and I would like to be a part of helping to interpret that complexity in many domains.

I have been a trained actuary scientist, an insurance agent, and a frontline IT specialist. Now I am finally coming full circle to return to a job in a statistical/analytical field, combining the mathematics I have worked to master for so long with the love I have gained for coding over the years. I am excited to continue learning everything I can in this field, and cut my teeth on some challenging problems!

As a mathematician, I studied Möbius strips, hyperbolic spaces, and the Novikov Conjecture. These days, I'm interesting in applying the same analytical skills that served me throughout my PhD to the real-world challenges and opportunities posed by the abundance of data that now exists.

I believe that it is possible to solve the educational inequality in America through data science. As a former educator and Teach for America corps member, I have developed a passion for expanding access to higher education for students from rural and low income backgrounds. There’s a line from Hamilton - “I’ve seen injustice in the world and I’ve corrected it.” I’ve seen the injustice, and it keeps me up at night. I hope that 40+ years from now, I can say, “I’ve seen injustice in the world, and I [was a part of a team/movement that] corrected it [a little bit].” I want to use data science to help correct the injustices I've seen in public education in America.
Fond of making better decisions by extracting meaning from data.

cohort.reelThemIn: Doctor of Science in Information Systems
cohort.bio: I have a background in Data Science, Development and Operations (DevOps), and Machine Learning. Deadline, budget and quality-driven; Expert in delivering turn-key Data Science solutions with resilient, scalable, and user-friendly components. Published author - HICSS best paper nomination. Bi-lingual: English and Russian.

'This stuff is fun!'  I can't believe I said that after attempting my first data project.  As a science and pre-engineering teacher, I've enjoyed 'engineering' and influencing young minds in the wiles of all things science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM).  Armed with more tools, I'm looking forward to the next chapter of my career as a data scientist in order to engage my passion for inquiry; creative, out-of-the-box thinking; and helping communities or businesses improve their lot through data analysis.  I'm looking forward to getting my hands dirty in the technical arena again.
